qas.question: What language family did Thracian and Balto-Slavic belong to?
What Indo-European groups belong to the Satem language family?
What language family originated in the mountains of Russia?

context: It was situated precisely in the western part of Central Asia that borders present-day Russia (and present-day Kazakhstan). It was in relative proximity to the other satem ethno-linguistic groups of the <a0_0><b2_0>Indo-European<b2_0/><a0_0/> family, like <b1_0>Thracian, Balto-Slavic<b1_0/> and others, and to common Indo-European's original homeland (more precisely, the steppes of southern Russia to the north of the Caucasus), according to the reconstructed linguistic relationships of common Indo-European.
